title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #742:** Let G be a graph on n vertices with diameter 2, such that deleting any edge increases the diameter. Is it true that G has at most n²/4 edges?

**Status: SOLVED** - Füredi (1992) proved YES for sufficiently large n.

title: HasDiameter
content:
**HasDiameter(G, d):** Graph G has diameter exactly d.

Requires: connected, all distances at most d, some pair at distance exactly d.

title: HasDiameter2
content:
**HasDiameter2:** Special case of diameter exactly 2.

Any two vertices are connected by a path of length at most 2.

title: deleteEdge
content:
**deleteEdge(G, u, v):** The graph G with edge (u,v) removed.

Preserves all other adjacencies while removing just this one edge.

title: IsCriticalEdge
content:
**IsCriticalEdge:** An edge (u,v) is critical if its deletion increases the diameter.

In a minimal diameter-2 graph, every edge must be critical.

title: IsMinimalDiameter2
content:
**IsMinimalDiameter2:** A graph with diameter 2 where every edge is critical.

This is the central object of study in Problem #742.

title: MurtyPlesnikBound
content:
**MurtyPlesnikBound(n) = n²/4:** The conjectured maximum number of edges.

This bound is achieved by the complete bipartite graph.

title: Complete Bipartite Graph
content:
**K_{a,b} has diameter 2:** The complete bipartite graph achieves diameter 2 with a*b edges.

For balanced partition, this gives n²/4 edges.

title: Balanced Bipartite Minimal
content:
**K_{n/2,n/2} is minimal diameter-2:** The balanced complete bipartite graph is edge-minimal for diameter 2.

This shows the bound n²/4 is tight.

title: Füredi's Theorem
content:
**Füredi (1992):** For sufficiently large n, every minimal diameter-2 graph has at most n²/4 edges.

This settles the Murty-Plesnik-Ore conjecture.

title: bound_is_tight
content:
**Theorem:** The bound n²/4 is achieved for all n at least 2.

The complete bipartite graph provides the extremal example.

title: Conjecture History
content:
**Timeline:** Ore (1960s) then Murty-Simon then Murty-Plesnik (1979) then Caccetta-Haggkvist then Furedi (1992)

The conjecture evolved through multiple researchers over 30 years.

title: IsDiameterCritical
content:
**IsDiameterCritical(G, d):** Graph has diameter d and every edge is critical for this diameter.

Generalizes minimal diameter-2 to arbitrary diameter.

title: minimal_iff_critical
content:
**Theorem:** IsMinimalDiameter2 is equivalent to IsDiameterCritical for diameter 2.

The two notions coincide for diameter 2.

title: erdos_742
content:
**Main Result:**
1. Furedi's bound: at most n²/4 edges (for large n)
2. Tightness: complete bipartite achieves the bound

**Status: SOLVED**
